intro: Hieracium pseudoloscosianum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and used in ecological restoration projects.
